metadata.Title: CVE-2017-8374 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The mad_bit_skip function in bit.c in Underbit MAD libmad 0.15.1b allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (heap-based buffer over-read and application crash) via a crafted audio file. Agostino Sarubbo discovered that libmad incorrectly handled certain audio files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or possibly other unspecified impact.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-8374` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmad0 - 0.15.1b-9ubuntu14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libmad package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.15.1b-9ubuntu14.04.1').
